title: Ben Webster & Harry Edison - 1962 - Ben Webster, Sweets Edis
description:
Ben Webster & Harry Edison - 1962 - Ben Webster, Sweets Edison
Vinyl 24 bits, 96 KHz

Tenor-saxophonist Ben Webster and trumpeter Harry "Sweets" Edison, both veterans of the swing era (although associated with different orchestras), had long wanted to record a full album together. The results, a swinging quintet set with pianist Hank Jones, bassist George Duvivier and drummer Clarence Johnston, are quite rewarding. There are two ballad features for the tenor ("How Long Has This Been Going on" and a beautiful version of "My Romance") and one for Edison ("Embraceable You") along with three medium-tempo collaborations. Nothing unexpected occurs but the melodic music is quite enjoyable. (AllMusic)

Track list:
01 - Better Go
02 - How Long Has This Been Going On
03 - Kitty
04 - My Romance
05 - Did You Call Her Today
06 - Embraceable You

Personnel:
Harry Edison - trumpet
Ben Webster - saxophone
Hank Jones - piano
George Duvivier - bass
Clarence Johnston - drums

Enjoy and share!
